data.text:
@DrEliDavid Remember when India was having COVID emergency with high numbers of deaths? All of sudden it was over with a RAPID drop in cases and deaths. The Indian government distributed ivermectin wide-scale. Hong Kong needs to implement the same strategy:

https://t.co/09dAlNDGbF

@DrEliDavid in South Korea, i guess these huge corona cases are due to presidential election!
and it is really strange for NewZealand,

@RBH58 @DrEliDavid Unfortunately, but realistically, it does appear that covid is not going to reduce dramatically without Omicron being allowed to circulate and take natural immunity with it. There would be a price to pay in mortality rates but long term would that save lives?
@DrEliDavid New Zealand is run by the most incompetent zero science following buffoon in the planet.
@DrEliDavid The disease moves where it’s most welcomed.

@LesserMegadeath @DrEliDavid of course he will not mention that

does not fit with his bleating about "freedums!"

@Dave99117584 @douglasritz @DrEliDavid Yes. The places that had a lot of infections now have few. Los Angeles County has one-fifth the population of South Korea but now has had (roughly) the same number of infections. Last week, Korea's daily average per capita was 100 times that of LA County.
